reviews.text: We had a great trip and our stay was made better by an amazing staff person, Zak. He greeted up every day we came in and suggested which runs on the hill we might like to try. He gave us excellent recommendations for dinner. When we had a question regarding our bill, he would not give up until he figured it out.
reviews.title: The staff was friendly and helpful. It was convenient to lifts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved that they took our skis from us and returned them the next day effortlessly. The location was close but quiet. Parking expensive
reviews.title: Its all about Service and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks Zak
reviews.title: FANTASTIC... CAN't WAIT TO DO IT AGAIN!!

reviews.text: We've stayed at this hotel and their hotel in Vancouver. Both places have great service, but this one has an incredible location as well, Really close to the lifts, but not in the noisey area of the village. But what we really loved about the hotel was the service, very down to earth and helpful. We'll come back for sure.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Service and Facility

reviews.text: The Listel at Whistler was a fantastic hotel. The staff are very friendly and will do anything to help make you stay more enjoyable. From booking activities for you to say hi every time you are in the reception area!!
reviews.title: Service was great!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights back in August 07 as part of our honeymoon. It was a great hotel but we struggled to find it at first but that was due to the map the car hire company had given us. The location was fantastic 2 mins walk to all the ameinities. We were asked if we would like to upgrade to a better room with a queen bed as we were honeymooners. We said that would be great. We were travelling with our 7 year old and when we got to the room you could not swing a cat with the pull out made up. So we changed back to our original room with 2 beds. Excellent facilities in this room. Fridge and tea and coffee facilities.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whistler itself is beautiful and we saw bears here just wandering around early in the morning. We were in the car though as I would not like to have met them face to face. I can recommend Earls to eat here also Ricks grill was fantastic really nice and very accomodating for children. Would definatly retrurn to whistler and this hotel.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced hotel for area

reviews.text: We arrived in Whistler without any reservations so we went to the tourist office. We were instructed, by the excellent office staff, to phone the town's hotel hotline using the dedicated phone in the office. We were found a hotel by the lady on the phone (we were predominantly budget driven, and the lady took this into account).
reviews.title: Great find but be prepared to hear the neighbours!

reviews.text: We drove to Whistler after getting off our cruise ship in Vancouver. The drive was spectacular, very easy to find Hotel with our GPS. Seemed like an older building, our room was facing the restaurant and somewhat the pool next door. We spent the weekend of a holiday and there was too much noise from college students. Noise was loud and constant until 3 am. The bed was confortable with plenty of pillows and free internet.
reviews.title: Okay stay but too much noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall okay, but dont know if we would stay again. Price was reasonable and parking was secured but tight, and it was extra.
reviews.title: Needs a good scrub and customer service training.

likes.disliked: — lack of cleanliness- providing you get a good room; its still an okay, affordable spot for family trips, tourists, etc. Just Check your room upon checkin!

reviews.text: Overall an expensive, dissapointing stay.
reviews.title: Two Sleepless Nights
No Air Conditioning - Stacked Parking
reviews.text: Pro's:

reviews.title: very close to everything and great location for skiers
reviews.text: -Pool, hottub available

I've stayed at several hotels in the Whistler Village and this one is the best all round hotel. The staff is always courteous and asking what they can do to help. The rooms are quite comfortable, although, admittedly, we don't spend a lot of time in them as we are up on the hill skiing! The Bearfoot Bistro is one of the best restaurants in Whistler and conveniently part of The Listel. I would definitely classify The Listel as a hidden gem of Whistler.
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty!….Repeatedly!!!

reviews.text: We had a last minute deal through www.Whistler.com. for Boxing Day (Dec 26). This is high season and we were surprised to get such a great deal. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds. Location is great. Parking is expensive, but it's comparable to the other hotels in the village. Beware of the tight parking stalls. If you have a larger vehicle, you might find it hard to park.
reviews.title: Great location, older finishings
Value for money and amazing service!!!
reviews.text: The room is newly renovated, with a new bathroom. The only complaint is the old air conditioner/heater. It's one of those attached to the outside wall and the fan has to be on for the heat to work. It was so noisy, I did not sleep well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 10 days. AWESOME service, great room and good food.
reviews.title: Not worth it...

reviews.text: My main issue with the hotel was the parking, which is not included and quite expensive. I believe it was $18 plus tax, which totalled about $22...BUT that is not even for 24 full hours. You can't check in until 4pm, but you have to move the car by 2pm if you check out...they don't even give you the courtesy of leaving the car until the end of the ski day. So we had to move the car in the morning and drive and pay to park in the public lot. The rooms also do not have kitchen facilities. We stayed in Holiday Inn the next weekend, which was same price, had full kitchen, less expensive parking and allowed us to keep the car in the garage until 6pm the next day after we checked out, so we could enjoy breakfast, ski whole day, even stop to relax after skiing without worrying about the car.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location in Whistler village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weekend we stayed at the Listel happened to be Easter weekend and there was also the Telus music festival going on and it was the last weekend for skiing on Whistler mountain so saying the village was busy is an absolute understatement.
reviews.title: Wild Party Weekend with Good Night's Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Listel were completely organized. They provided a super efficient car and ski valet service on both check-in and check-out. Each day of skiing our skis were brought out to us and then taken away at the end of the day. The hotel was noisy, as you would expect for such a busy weekend, but there was no antisocial behaviour. The check-in staff made it very clear to large groups that there was a zero tolerance policy to antisocial behaviour and I think this really helped.
reviews.title: Staff are INCREDIBLE, hotel is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We basically used the hotel as a place to sleep and shower, but it had so much more to offer and we will be back. On check-out our car was returned to us with our two empty starbucks cups removed and our water bottle filled. How fab is that! A great stay with superb staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful, helpful staff, clean rooms, nice sauna/hot tub/pool

reviews.text: We've been to Whistler many times but never stayed at The Listel before. Everything about the hotel is great. The rooms are very nice and clean, the pool and hot tub were great - it's the best one shoud expect from Best Western. But the absolute best part is the staff - they go over the top to be accommodating and helpful. They take pets and the staff even will watch them for you behind the front desk! We cannot say enough about the people there!!!
reviews.title: Decent hotel but beds leave your body achy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked on line and had not stayed at this hotel before. The rates were among the best in town at that time, and so we were surprised at the quality of both the service and the rooms. All the rooms have free wi-fi, and the cleaning staff are pleasant and good. The front desk staff go out of their way to help, especially a young man named Kendall who was a perfect host.
reviews.title: great location for access to lifts

reviews.text: Spent a few days skiing with my son. Outstanding staff. Cheerfully willing to help in anything we needed. Ditto the restaurant staff. Not always the case at Whistler.
reviews.title: Great getaway spot

reviews.text: Location is perfect. Off the noisy main routes buy just one minute walk away from it all. Very close to lifts. Good price. Only possible drawback is no kitchen facilities but, to my wife, this is a big plus.
reviews.title: Excellent service, excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be back.
reviews.title: Great hotel near the slopes

reviews.text: Service was excellent. A panel on our door jam broke when we opened the door, and a service technician was sent immediately to fix the problem. On our final day, after checkout, we were able to ski and then come back and use the facilities, including showers, hot tub, pool, sauna, etc. as long as we were out by 16:00 / 4:00pm.
reviews.title: Great Value in the Village!

reviews.text: The hotel is in Whistler village, just a short walk to the gondolas and apres ski activities.
reviews.title: got to love the listel hotel
